attributes.action: Stop Rejecting E-Petitions That Could Improve Democracy or Improve the Running of This Country
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I am not the only person that has recommended improving the democratic nature of this website by recording votes against e-petitions and critiques of e-petitions.  I think that this is a wondeful idea, but you have rejected it.  Why not allow e-petitioners to decide whether it is a good idea or not?  And, in another e-petition I asked for better cross-party collaboration.  This idea was also rejected.  Again, why not allow the great British public to share their feelings on this matter?  If there is enough support for an idea then surely it should be pursued and the government should put effort into trying to overcome any obstacles to implementation.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
